knowledgeItems.title: 4 Doors 40 Levels
knowledgeItems.content: The foundation of Haji Bektash Veli's teaching. It describes the maturation process of the human soul: Sharia, Tariqa, Marifa, and Haqiqa.

knowledgeItems.title: Imam Ali (Shah-i Merdan)
knowledgeItems.content: The one about whom Prophet Muhammad said, 'I am the city of knowledge, and Ali is its gate.' He is the Commander of the Faithful and the King of Braves.

knowledgeItems.title: Zulfiqar
knowledgeItems.content: The double-headed sword of Imam Ali. One tip represents justice, the other knowledge. 'There is no hero like Ali, no sword like Zulfiqar.'

knowledgeItems.title: Hand, Tongue, Loins
knowledgeItems.content: The fundamental moral rule of Alevism: Control your Hand (do not steal), your Tongue (do not speak evil), and your Loins (control your desires).

knowledgeItems.title: The 12 Imams
knowledgeItems.content: The 12 spiritual leaders starting with Imam Ali and ending with Imam Mahdi, carrying the light of Islam and the Ahl al-Bayt.

knowledgeItems.title: Musahiplik (Spiritual Brotherhood)
knowledgeItems.content: A sacred bond of brotherhood not by blood, but by oath (Ikrar). Musahips are responsible for each other in this world and the hereafter.

knowledgeItems.title: City of Consent (Rızalık)
knowledgeItems.content: The basis of worship and social life. Worship is not accepted if one has violated another's rights; mutual forgiveness and consent are required first.

knowledgeItems.title: Tevella and Teberra
knowledgeItems.content: The principle of loving those who love the Ahl al-Bayt (Tevella) and distancing oneself from those who oppress them (Teberra).

knowledgeItems.title: Cem Ceremony
knowledgeItems.content: The communal worship gathering where unity is achieved, symbolizing the Assembly of the Forty (Kırklar Meclisi).

knowledgeItems.title: 12 Services
knowledgeItems.content: The 12 duties performed to conduct the Cem: Murshid, Guide, Watchman, Lamp Lighter, Hymn Singer (Zakir), Sweeper, Water Carrier, etc.

knowledgeItems.title: Murshid-i Kamil (Perfect Guide)
knowledgeItems.content: The spiritual guide who sheds light on the path. Haji Bektash Veli says: 'One without a Murshid cannot solve their difficulties.'

knowledgeItems.title: Saz and Word (Stringed Quran)
knowledgeItems.content: The Baglama (Saz) is considered sacred, often called the 'Stringed Quran.' Prayers and hymns reach the Truth accompanied by music.

knowledgeItems.title: Ghadir Khumm
knowledgeItems.content: The event where Prophet Muhammad declared Ali as his successor and guardian. It is considered the greatest holiday in Alevism.

knowledgeItems.title: Enel Hak (I am the Truth)
knowledgeItems.content: The concept of Unity of Existence (Wahdat al-Wujud), summarized by Hallaj-i Mansur's words meaning 'I am not separate from God.'

knowledgeItems.title: Düşkünlük (Fallen)
knowledgeItems.content: The temporary or permanent exclusion from the community for those who commit major crimes (murder, adultery, etc.) and break the rules of the Path.

knowledgeItems.title: Cheragh (The Light)
knowledgeItems.content: The candle or light lit in Cems, representing the verse 'God is the Light of the heavens and earth' and the light of the Ahl al-Bayt.

knowledgeItems.title: Dar-ı Mansur
knowledgeItems.content: The standing posture in the Cem square during questioning. It symbolizes Hallaj-i Mansur sacrificing his life for the Truth.

knowledgeItems.title: Pençe-i Âl-i Abâ
knowledgeItems.content: Symbolizes the 5 Holy Figures: Prophet Muhammad, Imam Ali, Hz. Fatma, Imam Hasan, and Imam Husayn.

stories.title: Haji Bektash Veli and the Dove
stories.content: It is rumored that the Hunkar came to Anatolia not as a hawk to show power, but in the guise of a dove, representing peace.

stories.title: Imam Ali and Khaybar
stories.content: The battle where Imam Ali tore off the massive gate of the Khaybar Fortress, which was said to be unmovable, and used it as a shield.

stories.title: Sarı Saltuk's Wooden Sword
stories.content: The legend of Sarı Saltuk standing against tyrants with a wooden sword, showing that power lies in the heart and faith, not in steel.

stories.title: Abdal Musa and the Deer
stories.content: The story of Kaygusuz Abdal hunting a deer, only to find the arrow under Abdal Musa's arm, realizing the unity of souls.

stories.title: Yunus Emre's Wood
stories.content: Yunus carried only straight wood to Taptuk Emre's dervish lodge for 40 years, saying 'Even crooked wood cannot enter through this door.'

stories.title: Hz. Fatma's Wedding Dress
stories.content: The story of Hz. Fatma giving her own wedding dress to a beggar at her door on her wedding night, showing detachment from worldly goods.

stories.title: Hallaj-i Mansur
stories.content: The story of the great lover who was skinned alive for saying 'Enel Hak' (I am the Truth) but never turned back from his faith.

stories.title: Veysel Karani's Love
stories.content: The loyalty of Veysel Karani, who loved Prophet Muhammad without seeing him, came from Yemen, and returned with just his cloak.

stories.title: Balım Sultan
stories.content: Legends about Balım Sultan, the second Pir of the Bektashi order, who systematized the rituals and the path.

stories.title: Karacaahmet Sultan
stories.content: The saint who rode a rock as if it were a horse, demonstrating miracles against those who rode lions, showing power over the inanimate.

stories.title: Imam Ali and the Lion
stories.content: The revelation during the Miraj where the lion blocking Prophet Muhammad's path was recognized as possessing the mark of Ali.

stories.title: Seyyid Nesimi
stories.content: The great Hurufi poet who praised the Truth even while being skinned alive, never compromising his belief.

rumors.title: Battle of Karbala
rumors.content: The martyrdom of Imam Husayn and his 72 companions by Yazid's army in 680 AD after being left without water. The source of the Mourning.

rumors.title: Event of Ghadir Khumm
rumors.content: Prophet Muhammad's declaration: 'For whomever I am his Mawla (master), Ali is also his Mawla.'

rumors.title: Assembly of the Forty
rumors.content: The spiritual gathering Prophet Muhammad visited during Miraj, where women and men were one, and one grape was shared among forty.

rumors.title: Sivas (Madimak) Massacre
rumors.content: The tragic event on July 2, 1993, where 33 intellectuals and artists were burned to death in Sivas. We have not forgotten.

rumors.title: Baba Ilyas and Baba Ishak
rumors.content: The great resistance known as the Babai uprising, started by the Anatolian people against injustice during the Seljuk period.

rumors.title: Shah Kalender Chelebi
rumors.content: The struggle of Kalender Chelebi, a descendant of Hacı Bektaş, against Ottoman injustices during the reign of Suleiman the Magnificent.

rumors.title: Execution of Pir Sultan
rumors.content: Pir Sultan Abdal, executed in Sivas by Hızır Pasha for saying 'Let them turn, I will not turn from my path.'

rumors.title: Dersim Events
rumors.content: The tragic events and operations that took place in the Dersim region in 1937-38, and the execution of Seyit Rıza.

rumors.title: Çorum and Maraş Incidents
rumors.content: Attacks and massacres directed against Alevi citizens in 1978 and 1980.

rumors.title: Shah Kulu Rebellion
rumors.content: The uprising of Alevis in the Teke region against Ottoman pressure, sympathizing with Shah Ismail.

lokmaRecipes.title: Flour Halva
lokmaRecipes.desc: The most common 'Niyaz' distributed in Cems and funerals.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Roast flour patiently until it changes color. Add syrup. Shape with a spoon and distribute.

lokmaRecipes.title: Ashura (Noah's Pudding)
lokmaRecipes.desc: Symbol of unity and abundance, made at the end of the Muharram fast.
lokmaRecipes.ingredients: Wheat, Chickpeas, Beans, Dried Fruits, Sugar.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Boil at least 12 ingredients with prayers. Distribute to neighbors.

lokmaRecipes.title: Lokma Dessert
lokmaRecipes.desc: Fried sweet dough distributed for vows and charity.
lokmaRecipes.ingredients: Flour, Yeast, Salt, Water, Oil, Syrup.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Squeeze yeast dough in palm, fry in oil, then dip in syrup.

lokmaRecipes.title: Hıdrellez Pilaf
lokmaRecipes.desc: Meat pilaf made while welcoming Spring.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Boil the sacrificial meat, make pilaf with its broth. Shred meat on top.

lokmaRecipes.title: Kömbe
lokmaRecipes.desc: Traditional pastry made by Anatolian Alevis when visiting sacred sites.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Knead the dough, bake between two metal sheets or in an oven. It keeps you full.

lokmaRecipes.title: Niyaz Bread
lokmaRecipes.desc: Salty or slightly sweet bread distributed in Cems.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Knead dough, make patterns on top, bake, and share equally.

lokmaRecipes.title: Babiko (Zerfet)
lokmaRecipes.desc: A dish from Dersim/Sivas regions with butter and garlic yogurt.
lokmaRecipes.ingredients: Flour, Water, Salt, Butter, Garlic Yogurt.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Bake a thick bread, hollow it out. Crumble the inside back in, pour hot butter over it.

lokmaRecipes.title: Bat
lokmaRecipes.desc: Famous cold lentil dish of Tokat Alevis.
lokmaRecipes.ingredients: Green lentils, fine bulgur, tomato paste, walnuts, vine leaves.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Boil lentils, mix with other ingredients in a watery consistency. Eaten with vine leaves.

lokmaRecipes.title: Zülbiye
lokmaRecipes.desc: Meat dish with shallots made during Muharram.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Cook meat and chickpeas, add plenty of shallots. A special occasion dish.

lokmaRecipes.title: Sütlaç (Rice Pudding)
lokmaRecipes.desc: Light dessert known as 'milky food' in dervish lodges.
lokmaRecipes.steps: Boil rice, cook with milk and sugar until thickened. Can be baked on top.

semahItems.title: Semah of the Forty
semahItems.content: The most fundamental Semah turned in the Assembly of the Forty, expressing love and divine attraction.

semahItems.title: Cranes (Turnalar) Semah
semahItems.content: Symbolizes the flight of the crane and sending greetings to Imam Ali. Figures resemble bird wings.

semahItems.title: Wheel (Çark) Semah
semahItems.content: Symbolizes the rotation of the universe, atoms, and planets. Usually performed at the end of the Cem.

semahItems.title: Tahtacı Semahs
semahItems.content: Unique Semahs of the Tahtacı Turkmens of the Aegean/Mediterranean, characterized by sharp and rhythmic figures.

semahItems.title: Hubyar Semah
semahItems.content: An enthusiastic Semah performed by souls belonging to the Hubyar Sultan hearth in the Tokat region.

semahItems.title: Muhammad Ali Semah
semahItems.content: Expresses love for Muhammad and Ali. Hands look to the sky (receiving from Truth) and the ground (giving to the people).

semahItems.title: Semah of Hearts
semahItems.content: Symbolizes the unity of hearts, performed more slowly and with deep reverence.

semahItems.title: Haji Bektash Semah
semahItems.content: The Semah belonging to the Nevşehir region, performed for centuries in the Hunkar's dervish lodge.

semahItems.title: Urfa Kısas Semah
semahItems.content: Semah turned with unique hymns by Turkmen Alevis in the Kısas region.

semahItems.title: Mengü Semah
semahItems.content: A type of Semah common in the Aegean region, especially around Izmir.

niyazItems.title: Table Prayer (Gülbank)
niyazItems.content: Bismişah... May it increase and not decrease. May the Truth-Muhammad-Ali grant abundance. Halal to those who eat, proof to those who feed. Hu to the Truth.

niyazItems.title: Morning Prayer
niyazItems.content: Bismişah... May our day be blessed, may evil be repelled. May believers be happy. May the Truth-Muhammad-Ali be our helper, Bozatlı Hızır be our companion.

niyazItems.title: Bedtime Prayer
niyazItems.content: I lay down, Allah raise me, plunge me into light. While the soul leaves the body, send me with faith. My head on the pillow, my eye on the Dervish lodge. Hu.

niyazItems.title: Lokma Prayer
niyazItems.content: May your morsels be accepted, your wishes granted. May it be written in the register of glory. May the Truth protect, Hızır watch over. The tongue is ours, the breath is the Hunkar's.

niyazItems.title: Oath (Ikrar) Prayer
niyazItems.content: Allah Allah... May your oath be ancient, your face white, your heart pure. May your path be open, your light never extinguished. Recorded in the notebook of Truth-Muhammad-Ali.

niyazItems.title: Awakening the Light (Delil)
niyazItems.content: May our light burn and kindle, may God's light be upon our community. May the hearts of believers be filled with light. Hu to the Truth.

niyazItems.title: Journey Prayer
niyazItems.content: Bismişah... May you find intercession from the road you take and the Pir you call upon. May Hızır be your companion, Ali be your guide.

niyazItems.title: Prayer for the Sick
niyazItems.content: Allah Allah... Grant healing with your name Shafi. May Allah who gives the trouble also give the cure. Grant healing to the sick for the sake of the Ahl al-Bayt.

niyazItems.title: For Service Holders
niyazItems.content: May your service be accepted. May your face be white. May you never separate from the train of Truth-Muhammad-Ali. May your efforts not go to waste.

niyazItems.title: Nad-i Ali Prayer
niyazItems.content: Prayer read in difficult times: 'Call upon Ali, who is the manifestation of wonders. You will find him a helper in all your troubles...'

quotes.quote: Do not hurt, even if you are hurt.
quotes.author: Haji Bektash Veli

quotes.quote: The end of the path not guided by science is darkness.
quotes.author: Haji Bektash Veli

quotes.quote: Control your hand, your loins, and your tongue.
quotes.author: Haji Bektash Veli

quotes.quote: I am the city of knowledge, and Ali is its gate.
quotes.author: Prophet Muhammad

quotes.quote: Let them turn, I will not turn from my path.
quotes.author: Pir Sultan Abdal

quotes.quote: I would be a slave for forty years to him who teaches me a single letter.
quotes.author: Imam Ali

quotes.quote: Do not bow down to injustice. For along with your rights, you will lose your honor.
quotes.author: Imam Ali

quotes.quote: In hell, there is no wood; everyone carries their own fire.
quotes.author: Pir Sultan Abdal

quotes.quote: Love the created for the Creator's sake.
quotes.author: Yunus Emre

quotes.quote: The greatest miracle is working (labor).
quotes.author: Haji Bektash Veli

quotes.quote: The greatest book to read is the human being.
quotes.author: Haji Bektash Veli

quotes.quote: Come souls, let us be one.
quotes.author: Pir Sultan Abdal

quotes.quote: If the exterior is ruined, the interior cannot be prosperous.
quotes.author: Haji Bektash Veli

quotes.quote: Knowledge is superior to wealth. For you guard wealth; but knowledge guards you.
quotes.author: Imam Ali

quotes.quote: A person is an enemy of what they do not know.
quotes.author: Imam Ali

quotes.quote: Learn manners from the unmannerly.
quotes.author: Yunus Emre

quotes.quote: A rose blossomed in the garden of love, its scent spread to the world.
quotes.author: Kul Himmet

quotes.quote: Your love took me from myself, I need you, only you.
quotes.author: Yunus Emre

quotes.quote: Let us be one, let us be big, let us be alive.
quotes.author: Haji Bektash Veli

quotes.quote: Justice is the foundation of the state.
quotes.author: Caliph Omar (often referenced regarding Ali's justice)
